Patent Information.Patent Title: Anti-microbial Peptides And Methods Of Use Thereof
Patent Information.Abstract: Anti-microbial peptides and methods of use are provided.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.27591703] Gram-positive bacteria :Staphylococcus aureus isolates(MIC=6.0 ± 3.5 mg/L, MBC=6.0 ± 3.5 mg/L), Enterococcus faecalis isolates(MIC=5.3 ± 2.3 mg/L, MBC=6.7 ± 2.3 mg/L);Gram-negative bacteria :Pseudomonas aeruginosa isolates(MIC=4.0 ± 3.5 mg/L, MBC=4.7 ± 3.0 mg/L), Acinetobacter baumannii isolates(MIC=2.7 ± 1.2 mg/L, MBC=3.3 ± 1.2 mg/L)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.27591703] 0% hemolysis at 64 μg/ml against human red blood cells; 0% hemolysis at 32 μg/ml , 6% hemolysis at 64 μg/ml against sheep red blood cells
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria

Literature.Title: A synthesized cationic tetradecapeptide from hornet venom kills bacteria and neutralizes lipopolysaccharide in vivo and in vitro.
Literature.Author: Yibin G, Jiang Z, Hong Z, Gengfa L, Liangxi W, Guo W, Yongling L.

Literature.Title: Design and characterization of short hybrid antimicrobial peptides from pEM-2, mastoparan-VT1, and mastoparan-B.

Literature.Title: A new mast cell degranulating peptide, mastoparan-M, in the venom of the hornet Vespa mandarinia.
Literature.Author: Nakajima T.,Yoshida H.,Yasuhara T.,Hirai Y.
